name: War Angel (Bard 12 Red Dragon Disciple 10 Champion of Torm 18)
author: Theophilus Fist

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
I was looking to do a holy warrior who was not Smite dependent and could dish damage.  This is my first build since 2014.  The first 20 levels follow YarStarDawg's Bard 20/RDD 10/COT 10 build on the ECSE closely, mainly to get OC/DC at lvl 21.

Human, PvM 1-40, but can probably do well PvP.  By switching a couple of GS for Expertise/Improved Expertise you can give the build more D.

[Edited after Maximillian Kane's comments].

High STR helps vs. Crit Immune creatures, light Divine Wrath is still useful for short duration, Smite Evil less so.

Race-Human
STR-16
DEX-10
CON-14
WIS-8
INT-14
CHA-14

lvl 26 COT7

Final Stats:

Bard 12/RDD 10/CoT 18
STR 40 (+15)
DEX 10
CON 16 (+3)
INT 16 (+3)

CHR 16 (+3)

AB - 45 (mundane Scimitar)/42 (unarmed)/27 (ranged)
AC - 23 (naked)/34 (mundane plate/tower)

He gets MUCH easier to play once he gets Great Cleave & IKD.

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Hey Theophilus!

Firstly, I'd like to ask that you include the level of each class next to the level of the character. It's really confusing to look at this build otherwise. Like I'd have to count the levels to see how many levels of each class you took before 20.

Second, although I like the concept, I prefer the Bard 20 / RDD 10 / Cot 10. This build doesn't make much use of the Bard features and songs, which kind of makes it strange, because you don't invest levels (at least Bard 16 for a VERY GOOD Song), but you invest the feats onto it (Lingering Song and Curse Song). So maybe you can split the difference and go for Bard 16 / RDD 10 / CoT 14. You lose 1 feat (IKD) and a bit of saves, you get much better Bard spellcasting and Song. You'll still be dispellable, but your GMW will give a full +5 to your Scimitar (although playing in the OC that's irrelevant). 

Third, you're taking Epic Prowess before Epic Weapon Focus. That's typically the other way around. Better to take +2 AB first then +1 AB second.

At first glance, these are the improvements I can suggest.

Take it EZ!

1 - I will edit to include them

2 - Though I love bards, its purpose in this build is to get RDD in a Holy Warrior along with full Tumble (hence no PAL/SOR/RDD).  The other bardic stuff (song, casting) is gravy.  I guess a better move for my purposes is to drop Lingering Song & Curse Song so I can get Blind Fight in and get IKD pre-epic, then put an Epic Toughness in at Lvl 40.

Hey Theo!

If the purpose was to make a warrior, how about Bard 8 / RDD 10 / CoT 22 (going Bard 6 / RDD 8 / CoT 6 pre-epic)? You could then drop this Epic Toughness and get another Great Strength, plus the bonus feat from CoT 22 for another Great Strength. You'll need to delay DevCrit a little bit, but IMO it's worth it. You get 5 bonus feats from CoT in epics (8, 10, 14, 18 and 22): OC, then DC, then EWF, then AS, then EP. All your general feats go to Great Strength, and Voilá, you get yourself +1 AB, damage and DevCrit DC. And you have 2 skill dumps in epics, at 27 and 37, which are more than enough to keep your Tumble AC relevant.

Also, you went from CoT 7 to CoT 18 and ended up in CoT 28 in your edits LOL

Take it EZ!
